text: From 1906 to 1926, the Finnish Swimming Federation did not arrange a dedicated national competition, but spread out the hosting duties of the championship events to multiple clubs. == Diving == === Men === ==== Plain ==== Competed in Hanko on 10 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Placing figure ! Score |- | |align=left| O. Nenonen | 4 | 98.75 points |- | |align=left| Leo Suni | 5 | 97.50 points |- | |align=left| Yrjö Valkama | 9 | 86.25 points |- | 4 |align=left| H. Henriksson | 12 | 76.25 points |} Source: ==== Platform ==== Competed in Helsinki on 2 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Placing figure ! Score |- | |align=left| Oskar Wetzell | 4 | 313.60 points |- | |align=left| Leo Suni | 8 | 295.40 points |- | |align=left| O. Nenonen | 12 | 275.83 points |} Source: ==== Springboard ==== Competed in Helsinki on 3 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Placing figure ! Score |- | |align=left| Oskar Wetzell | 4 | 310.24 points |- | |align=left| Albert Nyman | 8 | 288.68 points |- | |align=left| O. Nenonen | 12 | 254.18 points |} Source: === Women === ==== Platform ==== Competed in Helsinki on 3 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Placing figure ! Score |- | |align=left| Vieno Lind | 5 | 173.0 points |- | |align=left| Anna Järvinen | 14 | 157.5 points |- | |align=left| Senni Aaltonen | 14 | 156.0 points |- | 4 |align=left| Julia Leibovitsch | 17 | 146.0 points |- | 5 |align=left| Hilda Kuusela | 25 | 135.5 points |} Source: == Swimming == === Men === ==== 100 metre freestyle ==== Competed in Vaasa on 27 July 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Jussi Kahma | 1:11.0 NR |- | |align=left| Yrjö Seuderling | 1:14.6 |} Source: ==== 500 metre freestyle ==== Competed in Turku on 10 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Martti Salokannel | 8:03.5 |- | |align=left| Arvo Aaltonen | 8:22.2 |- | |align=left| B. Lilius | 8:57.1 |} Source: ==== 1000 metre freestyle ==== Competed in Tampere on 25 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Martti Salokannel | 17:38.0 NR |- | |align=left| Vilhelm Lindgrén | 18:56.8 |- | |align=left| Aaro Tynell | 19:27.0 |- | 4 |align=left| J. Valovuori | 19:51.7 |} Source: ==== 100 metre backstroke ==== Competed in Pori on 16 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| W. Sjöholm | 1:43.1 |- | |align=left| J. Viklund | 1:49.2 |} Source: ==== 100 metre breaststroke ==== Competed in Tampere on 24 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Vilhelm Lindgrén | 1:22.5 NR |- | |align=left| Martti Sjöholm | 1:24.1 |- | |align=left| A. Viklund | 1:24.1 |- | 4 |align=left| Väinö Warelius | 1:24.9 |- | 5 |align=left| Herman Cederberg | 1:27.3 |- | 6 |align=left| Mantere | 1:34.1 |- | 7 |align=left| Aaro Tynell | 1:35.4 |} Source: ==== 200 metre breaststroke ==== Competed in Turku on 10 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Arvo Aaltonen | 3:01.6 NR |- | |align=left| Vilhelm Lindgrén | 3:11.4 |} Source: ==== 400 metre breaststroke ==== Competed in Pori on 16 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Arvo Aaltonen | 6:25.4 |- | |align=left| Martti Sjölholm | 7:28.9 |- | |align=left| Lauri Aaltonen | 8:00.1 |} Arvo Aaltonen's time broke the Finnish record, but could not be ratified because it was swum in a river. Source: ==== 100 metre life saving ==== Competed in Pori on 17 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Yrjö Seuderling | 1:46.8 |- | |align=left| Herman Cederberg | 1:53.0 |- | |align=left| Arvo Aaltonen | 2:12.2 |- | 4 |align=left| V. Sjöholm | 2:32.0 |} Seuderling's time broke the Finnish record, but could not be ratified because it was swum in a river. Source: ==== 4 × 50 metre freestyle relay ==== Competed in Vaasa on 27 July 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Club ! Team ! Time |- | |align=left| Vaasan Uimaseura |align=left| Martti Salokannel, Uuno Mäkipää, Jussi Kahma, Artturi Helenius | 2:07.3 NR |- | |align=left| Helsingfors Simsällskapet |align=left| H. Vasenius, V. Sjöholm, L. Stenij, F. Sjöström | 2:17.2 |} Source: === Women === ==== 50 metre freestyle ==== Competed in Helsinki on 2 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Lilly Blomster | 41.3 |- | |align=left| Hilda Kuusela | 42.0 |- | |align=left| Anna Järvinen | 45.0 |- | 4 |align=left| Sofia Gylling | 45.3 |- | 5 |align=left| Edith Johansson | 46.4 |- | 6 |align=left| Greta Lind | 46.7 |- | 7 |align=left| Vieno Lind | 47.6 |- | 8 |align=left| Laura Laaksonen | 48.7 |- | 9 |align=left| Olga Koistinen | 49.2 |- | 10 |align=left| Eva Brander | 50.0 |- | 11 |align=left| Helmi Ojander | 50.4 |} Source: ==== 100 metre freestyle ==== Competed in Helsinki on 3 August 1913. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Time |- | |align=left| Anna Järvinen | 1:43.0 |- | |align=left| Hilda Kuusela | 1:44.9 |- | |align=left| Lilly Blomster | 1:46.8 |- | 4 |align=left| Olga Koistinen | 2:03.1 |- | 5 |align=left| Sofia Gylling | 2:11.4 |- | 6 |align=left| Edith Grönholm | 2:12.2 |} Source: == Water polo == === Men === Competed in Tampere. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Rank ! Club ! Team |- | |align=left| Helsingfors Simsällskap |align=left| ? |- |rowspan=3| AC |align=left| Hämeenlinnan Uimaseura |align=left| ? |- |align=left| Tampereen Uimaseura |align=left| ? |- |align=left| Turun Uimaseura |align=left| Eero Ek, ? |} Matches: * on 24 August 1913: ** Tampereen Uimaseura won Hämeenlinnan Uimaseura 5–0 * on 25 August 1913: ** Helsingfors Simsällskap won Turun Uimaseura 1–0 (1–0, 0–0) ** Helsingfors Simsällskap won Tampereen Uimaseura by forfeit ** Turun Uimaseura won Tampereen Uimaseura by forfeit Source: == Sources == * === References === Category:National swimming competitions Category:National championships in Finland Category:Swimming competitions in Finland Category:1913 in Finnish sport Category:1913 in aquatics Category:Diving competitions in Finland Category:Water polo competitions
title: 1913 Finnish championships in aquatics
